99497.name: Wine (% total alcohol)
99497.description: Wine as a share of total alcohol consumption.
99497.datasetName: Alcohol consumption by type since 1890 (Alexander & Holmes, 2017)
99497.s_name: Alcohol consumption by type since 1890 (Alexander & Holmes, 2017)

source.name: Alcohol consumption by type since 1890 (Alexander & Holmes, 2017)
source.dataPublishedBy: Holmes, A. J., & Anderson, K. (2017). Convergence in national alcohol consumption patterns: New global indicators. Journal of Wine Economics, 12(2), 117-148.
source.additionalInfo:
Breakdown of alcohol consumption by type (wine, beer and spirits) in select high-income countries where data is available. This is presented as each beverage's share of total pure alcohol consumption.

The original paper presents these trends as 5-year averages (e.g. 1980–1984). In this data we allocate a single year to each 5-year average – the last year of the period (1984 in this case).
